Management – Business Administration

Degree

Bachelor of Science in Management – Business Administration

School

Business

Department

Management

Program at a Glance

Management is the art and science of helping managers understand how to utilize resources efficiently and effectively, leading organizations to greater prosperity. The curriculum includes organization-wide topics such as organizational design, entrepreneurship, and corporate social responsibility; policy courses such as human resource management and strategic management; and skillbuilding courses such as negotiation, leadership, cross-cultural management, and decision-making.

Careers

Management graduates work in various professions, including marketing, retail, and human resources. They may also work in the commercial, industrial, and public management sectors. The degree can also open doors for those with an entrepreneurial instinct who want to head their own companies. 

Companies that have hired Management graduates include Cintas Corporation, Covance, Enterprise Holdings, FBI, Johnson & Johnson, Management Planning, Inc., Merrill Lynch, MSSL Inc., New Jersey Bureau of Pensions and Benefits, PVH, Sage Hospitality, Sherwin-Williams Company, Towers Perrin, and UPS.

Programs of Study

Bachelor’s degree

Management – Business Administration, BS 

Accelerated degrees

Management and Organizations, BS/MS

Business Administration, BS/MBA

Students in the management specialization can pursue a broad course of study, rounding out the management curriculum with free electives that reflect their academic and professional interests. Or they can follow one of two tracks within the specialization:

The General Management track is well-suited to students seeking the solid foundation in managerial knowledge and skills needed to become a performing manager, change agent, consultant (with some experience), or entrepreneur in for-profit or nonprofit organizations. 

The Human resources management track prepares students for careers as human resources managers, compensation specialists, training and development professionals, recruiters, and more.

Internships

Internships are strongly encouraged. They provide valuable experience and training and enable students to stand out from other prospective job candidates. Some companies that have provided internships include ACLU, Johnson & Johnson, Merrill Lynch, New Jersey Bureau of Pensions and Benefits, PVH, Rue Insurance, Sodexo, and Trenton Thunder.

Study Abroad

Management majors have the opportunity to study abroad. TCNJ has relationships with colleges and universities in more than 50 countries. By studying abroad, students gain a better understanding of themselves and the interrelationship of business culture globally; increase their intercultural communication skills; and explore a cultural setting that may include visits to historic sites and museums as well as to foreign businesses, government, and authorities.

Wide-Ranging Faculty Expertise

Faculty members at TCNJ are recognized by peers, organizations, businesses, and industries across the country and internationally. 

Several specialty areas within the field of management include: 

  • compensation and benefits
  • cross-cultural management 
  • employee and labor relations 
  • entrepreneurship 
  • ethics 
  • leadership 
  • managing organizational change 
  • managing teams 
  • negotiation 
  • operations and supply chain management 
  • organizational behavior 
  • quantitative methods for decision-making 
  • strategy 
  • training and development
